purpleculture_pinyin:
cóng
from; through; via; to follow; to obey; to engage in (an activity); never (in negative sentence); (Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer; assistant; auxiliary; subordinate; related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
из; через; через; следовать; подчиняться; заниматься (деятельностью); никогда (в отрицательном предложении); (Тайвань пр. [Zong4]) ретейнер; помощник; вспомогательный; подчиненный; связаны общим дедушкой по отцовской линии или более ранним предком

zòng

rtega_mnemonic:
從從RS
从从		従from, by, accompany, undertake, manage, attend to
  • RS. the one that follows 从 (by foot 彳) on the road 龰
  • ⓢ person 人 following another person 人
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 从)
Pictophonetic: 从 indicates the sound; 彳 (step) conveys the meaning.
Antonyms: 主
purpleculture_examples:
從事 [ cóng shì ]: to go for; to engage in; to undertake; to deal with; to handle; to do
從而 [ cóng ér ]: thus; thereby
從此 [ cóng cǐ ]: from now on; since then; henceforth
從來 [ cóng lái ]: always; at all times; never (if used in negative sentence)
purpleculture_tree:

heisig_chinese_memo: The streets seems kind of empty so I followed a massive trail of footprints and found tons of persons in a queue for the new spicy Hunan (Chinese province known for spicy food) restaurant.
Ru_trainchinese:
cóng: (предлог) из, от, с (о времени, месте или точке зрения)
cóng: (предлог/нареч) через (используется с местом); в соответствии с; никогда (перед отрицанием)
cóng: (графема) следовать; подчиняться; участвовать в; принимать на себя; подчиненный; второстепенный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: obey (从), stop (龰), then take a step (彳) to obey
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Pictograph of one person following another.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The word “travel” originates from the scene of marching in line: (旅, lü, travel). A flagand two people marching (從, 从, cong=ts’ung, follow). In other words, it symbolizes people following the flag and marching. At that time, 500 soldiers were called up 旅 (lü) for war. Therefore this character implies about 500 people following a military flag.
humanum_full_description_en:
A bronze inscription from the " left foot " from the " from " or inscriptions from " Chuo ", " from " is " from " the beginning of the text. The original meaning of " Cong " is to follow, and " Cong " emphasizes to follow on the road, so from "辵". "Said Wen": "Cong, follow you. Congyou, Cong, Congyisheng."

In today " from " generally regarded as the " from " shorthand, but in fact " from the ancient," " from filling" " Chuo " part (left foot + only) made " from ." See " From ".

The meaning of the oracle bone inscriptions is unknown, and the inscriptions on the inscriptions on the inscriptions on the bones of the bones of the oracle bones mean to go with you, 騾簋: "Hang from the king to levy Chu Jing"; and express obedience, Wang Ding of Zhongshan: "Fu (Fu) mother's (yes) follow"; " Zong " means indulgence, Huanzi Meng Jianghu: "Use Cong (Zong) Er Da Le".
humanum_short_description_en: A bronze inscription from the " left foot " from the " from " or inscriptions from " Chuo ", " from " is " from " the beginning of the text. The original meaning of " Cong " is to follow, and " Cong " emphasizes to follow on the road, so from "辵".
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「彳」從「从」，金文或從「辵」，「从」是「從」的初文。「从」的本義是跟隨，而「從」則強調相隨於路途之上，故從「辵」。《說文》：「從，隨行也。从辵、从，从亦聲。」

　　在今天「从」一般被視為「從」的簡寫，但其實「从」古已有之，「从」加注「辵」部(彳+止)而成「從」。參見「从」。

　　甲骨文用義不詳，金文表示隨行，𨾊弔簋：「𨾊弔從王員征楚荊」；又表聽從，中山王鼎：「隹俌(傅)母氏(是)從」；又通作「縱」，表示放縱，洹子孟姜壺：「用從(縱)爾大樂」。
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「彳」從「从」，金文或從「辵」，「从」是「從」的初文。「从」的本義是跟隨，而「從」則強調相隨於路途之上，故從「辵」。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
從 (Simplified: 从)
Total strokes: 11; Radical: 彳
Pictophonetic: 从 indicates the sound; 彳 (step) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 彳 [ chì ] to step with the left foot
    • ⿱ Above to below
      • 从 [ cóng ] from, by, since, whence, through
      • 足 [ zú ] foot; to attain, to satisfy; enough
Antonyms: 主
  • Pinyin: cóng

    English Definition: from; through; via; to follow; to obey; to engage in (an activity); never (in negative sentence); (Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer; assistant; auxiliary; subordinate; related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
    Example Words:
    從事 [ cóng shì ]: to go for; to engage in; to undertake; to deal with; to handle; to do
    從而 [ cóng ér ]: thus; thereby
    從此 [ cóng cǐ ]: from now on; since then; henceforth
    從來 [ cóng lái ]: always; at all times; never (if used in negative sentence)
    More: 從* | *從 | *從*
  • Pinyin: zòng

    English Definition: second cousin

①依順：順從。盲從。從善如流。
②採取，按照：從優。
③跟隨：願從其後。
④跟隨的人：侍從。僕從。
⑤參與：從業。從政。投筆從戎。
⑥由，自：從古至今。從我做起。
⑦次要的：主從。從犯。
⑧宗族中次於至親的親屬：從父(伯父、叔父的通稱)。
⑨中國魏以後，古代官品(有“正品”和“從品”之分，宋代龍圖閣大學士爲從二品)。
⑩姓氏。

從此 [ cóng cǐ ]: from now on; since then; henceforth
從來 [ cóng lái ]: always; at all times; never (if used in negative sentence)
①古同“縱”，豎，直。
②古同“縱”，放任。

甲金文從「 彳 」從「 从 」，金文或從「 辵 」，「 从 」是「 從 」的初文。「 从 」的本義是跟隨，而「 從 」則強調相隨於路途之上，故從「 辵 」。《說文》：「從，隨行也。从辵、从，从亦聲。」 在今天「 从 」一般被視為「 從 」的簡寫，但其實「 从 」古已有之，「 从 」加注「 辵 」部(彳+止)而成「 從 」。參見「 从 」。 甲骨文用義不詳，金文表示隨行，𨾊弔簋：「𨾊弔從王員征楚荊」；又表聽從，中山王鼎：「隹俌(傅)母氏(是)從」；又通作「 縱 」，表示放縱，洹子孟姜壺：「用從(縱)爾大樂」。
A bronze inscription from the " left foot" from the " from" or inscriptions from " Chuo", " from" is " from" the beginning of the text. The original meaning of " Cong" is to follow, and " Cong" emphasizes to follow on the road, so from " 辵". "Said Wen": "Cong, follow you. Congyou, Cong, Congyisheng." In today " from" generally regarded as the " from" shorthand, but in fact " from the ancient," " from filling" " Chuo" part (left foot + only) made " from." See " From". The meaning of the oracle bone inscriptions is unknown, and the inscriptions on the inscriptions on the inscriptions on the bones of the bones of the oracle bones mean to go with you, 騾簋: "Hang from the king to levy Chu Jing"; and express obedience, Wang Ding of Zhongshan: "Fu (Fu) mother's (yes) follow"; " Zong" means indulgence, Huanzi Meng Jianghu: "Use Cong (Zong) Er Da Le".

從字的基本解释

從
cóng

從
zòng
均见“从”。

從字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cóng］
［《廣韻》疾容切，平鍾，從。］
亦作“従1”。“从1”的繁体字。“松2”的被通假字。
(1)跟，随。跟从，跟随。
(2)跟，随。指随从的人。
(3)跟，随。指从死，殉葬。
(4)跟，随。指从嫁，陪嫁。
(5)跟，随。指从夫，谓已嫁。
(6)使跟从，使跟随。谓带领。
(7)指先导；引导者。
(8)往就；到。
(9)聚合；归属。
(10)次；副。
(11)堂房亲属。
(12)指堂房亲属中的世、代。
(13)追逐。
(14)追求。
(15)听从；顺从。
(16)和顺；安顺。指各安其位、各守其职的局面或秩序。
(17)引申为通顺妥贴。
(18)如意；顺遂。
(19)任凭；听凭。
(20)从事；参与。
(21)谓采取某种方针或方法。
(22)见“從從”。
(23)经由；经过。
(24)古代算术中的术语。犹和数或乘积。
(25)介词。在；由。介绍动作行为发生的处所。
(26)介词。自。介绍动作行为发生的时间。

從字的康熙字典解释

【寅集下】【彳字部】　從； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页368第18
【廣韻】疾容切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】牆容切，?俗平聲。【說文】本作从。相聽也。【書·益稷】汝無面從。【說命】后從諫則聖。　又【廣韻】就也。【易·乾卦】雲從龍，風從虎。【禮·曲禮】謀于長者，必操几杖以從之。　又【爾雅·釋詁】自也。【詩·小雅】伊誰云從。【箋】言譖我者，是言從誰生乎。【晉書·明帝紀】不聞人從日邊來。　又姓。【廣韻】漢有將軍從公。【何氏姓苑】今東筦人。　又【廣韻】【集韻】?七恭切，促平聲。【廣韻】從容也。【正韻】從容，舒緩貌。【書·君?】從容以和。【禮·中庸】從容中道。　又【集韻】書容切，音舂。從容，久意。【禮·學記】待其從容，然後盡其聲。　又【集韻】將容切，音蹤。東西曰衡，南北曰從。【詩·齊風】衡從其畝。【史記·蘇秦傳】從合則楚王，衡成則秦帝。　又與蹤通。【史記·聶政傳】重自?以絕從。【前漢·張湯傳】從迹安起。　又【集韻】祖動切，音總。太高貌。【韻會】髻高也。【禮·檀弓】尔無從從爾。　又【集韻】鋤江切，浞平聲。義同。　又【唐韻】慈用

cóng

From
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cóng］
["Guangyun" Chi Rong Qi, Ping Zhong, from. ]
Also known as "従1". Traditional characters of "从1". "Song 2" was passed falsely.
(1) Follow, follow. Follow, follow.
(2) Follow, follow. Refers to the follower.
(3) Follow, follow. Refers to death, burial.
(4) Follow, follow. Refers to marrying, dowry.
(5) Follow, follow. Refers to the husband, that is married.
(6) Make follow, make follow. That is to lead.
(7) Refers to the leader; the guide.
(8) To go; to.
(9) Aggregation; attribution.
(10) Times; Vice.
(11) Relatives in the hall.
(12) Refers to the generation and generation of relatives in the house.
(13) Chase.
(14) Pursuit.
(15) Obey; obey.
(16) Heshun; Anshun. Refers to a situation or order in which each holds its place and each keeps its duties.
(17) The extension is tongshun and proper stickers.
(18) Ruyi; smoothly.
(19) Let it go; let it go.
(20) To engage in; to participate.
(21) It means adopting a certain policy or method.
(22) See "Congcong".
(23) To pass; to pass.
(24) Terminology in ancient arithmetic. Juhe number or product.
(25) Prepositions. In; by. Introduce the place where the action takes place.
(26) Prepositions. from. Introduce the time when the action occurred.
